title: Colin Scott (rugby league)
text:
Colin Scott (born 23 March 1960) is an Australian former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1970s and 1980s. Primarily a , he was an inaugural player for the <a href="Queensland%20Maroons">Queensland</a> <a href="State%20of%20Origin">State of Origin</a> team and the <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>.
Background.
Born in <a href="Charters%20Towers%2C%20Queensland">Charters Towers, Queensland</a>, Scott is of <a href="Indigenous%20Australian">Indigenous</a> descent and played his junior rugby league for Souths <a href="Townsville%2C%20Queensland">Townsville</a>, alongside future teammate <a href="Gene%20Miles">Gene Miles</a>. 
Playing career.
Scott played senior rugby league for Souths Townsville, where he first represented <a href="Queensland%20rugby%20league%20team">Queensland</a> in the interstate series in 1979. In 1980, he moved to <a href="Brisbane">Brisbane</a>, joining the <a href="Easts%20Tigers">Easts Tigers</a>. That season, he was selected at fullback for the first ever <a href="1980%20State%20of%20Origin%20game">State of Origin game</a>, despite being in reserve grade at the time.
In 1981, Scott moved to the <a href="Wynnum%20Manly%20Seagulls">Wynnum Manly Seagulls</a>, starting at fullback in their <a href="Brisbane%20Rugby%20League%20Premiership">BRL</a>'s <a href="Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a> victory over <a href="Souths%20Magpies">Souths Magpies</a> a year later. In 1983, Scott was selected at fullback in the Australian side for their second Test match against <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> after an injury to incumbent <a href="1982%20Kangaroo%20tour%20of%20Great%20Britain%20and%20France">1982 Kangaroo Tour</a> fullback <a href="Greg%20Brentnall">Greg Brentnall</a>. Despite 25 appearances for his state during his career (including 17 <a href="Rugby%20League%20State%20of%20Origin">State of Origin</a> appearances), Scott did not represent Australia again. 
In 1985, Scott joined the <a href="Castleford%20Tigers">Castleford Tigers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Castleford%20Tigers%20players">Heritage № 654</a>), spending two seasons with the club. That year, he played in their 18–22 loss to the <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="1985%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1985</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1985%E2%80%9386%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1985–86 season</a>. In 1986, he started at in the 31–24 victory over <a href="Hull%20F.C.">Hull F.C.</a> in the <a href="1986%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1986</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1986%E2%80%9387%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1986–87 season</a>.
Scott played for Queensland in the interstate series and <a href="State%20of%20Origin%20series">State of Origin</a> series from 1979 to 1987, until losing his place to former <a href="Souths%20Magpies">Souths Magpies</a> and then-<a href="Canberra%20Raiders">Canberra Raiders</a> fullback <a href="Gary%20Belcher">Gary Belcher</a> in 1986, though he was recalled to the team on the wing for the <a href="1987%20State%20of%20Origin%20series">1987 State of Origin series</a>, mostly due to injury to regular Maroons centre and goal kicker <a href="Mal%20Meninga">Mal Meninga</a>. During the series, Scott came in for heavy criticism for his poor goal kicking. Scott played his last game for Queensland from the bench in 1987 series exhibition game at <a href="Veterans%20Memorial%20Stadium%20%28Long%20Beach%29">Veterans Memorial Stadium</a> in <a href="California">California</a>.
In 1988, Scott joined the newly established <a href="Brisbane%20Broncos">Brisbane Broncos</a>, who were admitted to the <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20League%20premiership">New South Wales Rugby League premiership</a>. He spent just one season at the club, playing 14 games, including their first ever premiership game against the <a href="Manly%20Warringah%20Sea%20Eagles">Manly Warringah Sea Eagles</a>.
Post-playing career.
In 2000, Scott was awarded the <a href="Australian%20Sports%20Medal">Australian Sports Medal</a> for his contribution to Australia's international standing in rugby league.
